div.head: For painting in oil on taffeta without the oil running
div.ab: A layer of batture needs to be made, which is made of well cooked honey and turpentine of colle forte soaked for 24 hours in water then gently bring to the boil so that it is hardly strong. Next stir in a little honey to soften it, and let it boil all together. And on top of this layer, which will soon be dry, you will be able to paint in oil, which will soften the layer even more, and which can also serve to make a ground layer for gold. water of alum also keeps oil from running.

div.head: Ground layer for gold leaf on parchment or paper
div.ab: Make very clear starch glue, showing little thickness. And make thereof six or five layers, and on the last, once it is half dried, apply your gold.

div.head: For cleaning gold leaf applied to iron
div.ab: Rub your weapons or other gilt objects with dry horse dung.

div.head: For whitening ceruse
div.ab: Hard-boil eggs, divide them in half and take the yolk out, and between the two halves of the white put a piece of ceruse, and tie them together with thread. Then boil in clear water, and it will become entirely black, and thus the ceruse will be purified. Some reheat it over fire and it becomes very white.
